Primary Objective: To provide income support to all land-holding farmer families.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides Rs. 6,000 per year in three equal installments.
Target Beneficiaries: All land-holding farmer families, subject to exclusions.
Funding Structure: Central Sector Scheme (100% central government funding)

Primary Objective: To provide crop insurance to farmers against crop loss due to unforeseen events.
Key Features & Benefits: Financial support for crop damage; stabilizes farmers' income.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers growing notified crops.
Funding Structure: Centrally Sponsored Scheme (Central and State governments share the premium subsidy)

Primary Objective: To provide a social security net and pension for small and marginal farmers in their old age.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides a monthly pension of Rs. 3,000 after the age of 60.
Target Beneficiaries: Small and Marginal Farmers (SMFs) in the age group of 18-40.

Primary Objective: To expand irrigation coverage and improve water use efficiency.
Key Features & Benefits: "Per Drop More Crop" component promotes micro-irrigation (drip and sprinkler).
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers across the country, particularly in dry regions.

Primary Objective: To provide medium-to-long-term debt financing for post-harvest management projects.
Key Features & Benefits: Financial assistance for building cold storage, warehouses, and other infrastructure.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, FPOs, PACS, and entrepreneurs.

Primary Objective: To create a pan-India electronic trading portal for agricultural produce.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides farmers with a unified market for better price discovery.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers registered on the e-NAM portal.

Primary Objective: To provide farmers with a report on their soil's health and suggest nutrient management.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides a Soil Health Card (SHC) every two years, promoting balanced fertilizer use.
Target Beneficiaries: All farmers across the country.

Primary Objective: To ensure a holistic development of the agriculture and allied sectors.
Key Features & Benefits: Supports various state-specific agricultural projects and initiatives.
Target Beneficiaries: State governments and farmers in participating states.

Primary Objective: To increase the production of rice, wheat, pulses, and coarse cereals.
Key Features & Benefits: Promotes the use of high-yielding seeds, improved farming practices, and technology.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers in identified districts.

Scheme Name: National Mission on Edible Oils - Oil Palm
Primary Objective: To boost domestic edible oil production and reduce import dependence.
Key Features & Benefits: Supports oil palm cultivation with financial assistance for planting material and processing units.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers cultivating oil palm.

Primary Objective: To promote chemical-free, sustainable agriculture practices.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for organic and natural farming methods.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers adopting natural farming.

Nodal Ministry/Department: Department of Financial Services (Ministry of Finance)
Primary Objective: To provide adequate and timely credit support to farmers from the banking sector.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides short-term loans for crop production and other related expenses.
Target Beneficiaries: All farmers, including tenant farmers and sharecroppers.

Scheme Name: Pradhan Mantri Annadata Aay SanraksHan Abhiyan
Primary Objective: To ensure remunerative prices to farmers for their produce.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides a safety net for farmers through Price Support Scheme (PSS), Price Deficiency Payment Scheme (PDPS), and Private Procurement & Stockist Scheme (PPSS).
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers growing notified crops like pulses, oilseeds, and copra.

Primary Objective: To promote organic farming in clusters.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for organic farming certification, training, and marketing of produce.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers who form a cluster and adopt organic farming practices.

Scheme Name: National Mission on Agricultural Extension and Technology
Primary Objective: To strengthen agricultural extension systems and promote technology.
Key Features & Benefits: Includes sub-missions on farm mechanization, agricultural extension, seeds, and plant protection.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers and agricultural extension workers.

Primary Objective: To ensure the quantitative and qualitative improvement in livestock production systems.
Key Features & Benefits: Supports animal husbandry, poultry farming, and sheep & goat breeding.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, entrepreneurs, and Self-Help Groups (SHGs) involved in livestock farming.

Primary Objective: To conserve and develop indigenous bovine breeds.
Key Features & Benefits: Promotes indigenous cattle breeding and provides support for setting up breeding centers.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers and breeders of indigenous cattle.

Primary Objective: To enhance agricultural productivity, especially in rain-fed areas.
Key Features & Benefits: Focuses on integrated farming, water use efficiency, and soil health management.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, particularly in rain-fed and dryland regions.

Scheme Name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Urja Suraksha Evam Utthan Mahabhiyan
Nodal Ministry/Department: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
Primary Objective: To promote solar energy in the agriculture sector.
Key Features & Benefits: Supports the installation of solar pumps and grid-connected solar power plants on farmers' land.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers for irrigation needs.
Funding Structure: Central Sector Scheme with state contribution

Scheme Name: Mission for Integrated Development of Horticulture
Primary Objective: To promote the holistic growth of the horticulture sector.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides support for planting material, cultivation, post-harvest management, and marketing of horticultural crops.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers involved in horticulture.

Nodal Ministry/Department: NABARD, Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying
Primary Objective: To generate self-employment and provide infrastructure for the dairy sector.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides financial assistance for setting up small dairy farms, mini-dairy units, and milk processing infrastructure.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, individual entrepreneurs, NGOs, and cooperatives.
Funding Structure: Implemented through NABARD, Central Government subsidy

Primary Objective: To bridge the skill gap in the agriculture sector.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides skill development training programs for farmers and agricultural workers.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, rural youth, and farm laborers.

Primary Objective: To promote scientific bee-keeping and honey production.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides support for setting up apiaries, training, and marketing of bee products.
Target Beneficiaries: Farmers, beekeepers, and entrepreneurs.

Nodal Ministry/Department: Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, NABARD
Primary Objective: To provide extension services and support for agri-businesses.
Key Features & Benefits: Provides training and credit facilities to agricultural graduates to establish their own agri-ventures.
Target Beneficiaries: Unemployed agricultural graduates.
Funding Structure: Supported by NABARD and commercial banks.
